title: Spacings in forms
summary: Good spacing makes forms easier to read, scan, and complete. It helps users see how fields relate to each other, creates a clear hierarchy, and ensures enough room for focus states and touch targets. Consistent spacing makes forms feel structured and effortless to use.

columns.title: Vertical spacing
columns.content: Fields that belong together should have smaller spacing between them to visually form a group. This helps users understand that the fields are related and should be completed together. Use consistent vertical spacing within each group to create a calm, structured flow and support quick scanning.

columns.title: Horisontal spacing
columns.content:
When fields are placed side by side, their spacing should follow the grid gaps to stay consistent with the overall layout. This means the gap will vary between screen sizes, adapting to the grid defined for each breakpoint. This creates a balanced rhythm in the form.  

Avoid placing fields side by side if it risks reducing readability or accessibility, for example, when labels or helper texts vary in length, or when users need to compare or enter longer text values. In those cases, stacking fields vertically provides better clarity and flow.
